panels.description: Requests per second by HTTP status
panels.title: Requests by status

panels.description: Requests per second by endpoint, HTTP method and HTTP status
panels.title: Requests by endpoint

panels.description: Latency by endpoint and HTTP method

targets.expr:
(
  sum by (method, uri) (rate(http_server_requests_seconds_sum{application="$app",status=~"2..|3..|4..|5.."}[5m]))
  /
  sum by (method, uri) (rate(http_server_requests_seconds_count{application="$app",status=~"2..|3..|4..|5.."}[5m]))
)
unless
(sum by (method, uri) (rate(http_server_requests_seconds_count{application="$app",status=~"2..|3..|4..|5.."}[5m])) == 0)

panels.title: Latency by endpoint

panels.description: Database connection timeouts per second (should be ~0)
panels.title: Timeouts

targets.expr:
sum by (repository, method) (rate(spring_data_repository_invocations_seconds_sum{application="$app",state="SUCCESS"}[5m]))
/
sum by (repository, method) (rate(spring_data_repository_invocations_seconds_count{application="$app",state="SUCCESS"}[5m]))
unless
sum by (repository, method) (
  rate(spring_data_repository_invocations_seconds_count{application="$app",state="SUCCESS"}[5m])
) == 0

panels.description: Ratio of cache get operations that were served from cache (hits  total gets), per cache.

targets.expr:
(
  sum by (cache) (rate(cache_gets_total{application="$app", result="hit"}[5m]))
  /
  sum by (cache) (rate(cache_gets_total{application="$app"}[5m]))
)
unless
(sum by (cache) (rate(cache_gets_total{application="$app"}[5m])) == 0)

panels.title: Hit ratio

panels.description: Cache get operations (hits) per second, split by cache name.
panels.title: Cache Hits

panels.description: Cache get operations (miss) per second, split by cache name.
panels.title: Cache Misses

panels.description:
Mean Redis command latency observed by the application (Lettuce client).
Includes network, Redis execution, and client processing time.
panels.title: Redis latency

panels.description:
Rate of Redis commands issued by the application, grouped by command.
Useful to correlate load with latency changes.
panels.title: Redis command rate
